--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:
>
> Yes; if it happened now it would be visible 500 years from now. If it
> happened 500 years ago, it would be visible now.
> 
> However, there are people including Greg Hodowanec who have collected some
> evidence that gravity waves are near instantaneous, and that if a supernova
> occurred now, it could be detected now. Still, we wouldn't SEE it for 500
> years. And the equipment described by Hodowanec (which I've built) can't
> tell us WHERE the supernova occurred, just the fact it did.
> Zack
